descript.abstract: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer. The spatial data and CAMA data was updated in 2016 by CMRPC as part of a MassGIS enhancement project. The spatial data and CAMA data is updated on an annual basis by the Central Massachusetts Regional Planning Commission (CMRPC). The data was last updated in 2019.

idinfo.accconst: This digital parcel data layer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis
idinfo.useconst: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.
idinfo.native: This parcel data is submitted to MassGIS in a file geodatabase. It will be incorporated into the MassGIS SDE database, and may be converted into other GIS data types for future distribution.
idinfo.datacred: CMRPC. Initial data conversion by James W. Sewall Company

dataqual.logic: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

horizpa.horizpar: Data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.

srcinfo.typesrc: tif files created from paper maps
srcinfo.srccontr: This GIS dataset represents a digital version of assessor tax maps that were previously converted and processed to be compliant with MassGIS Level 2 parcel standards, and now provides the basic framework for the upgrade to level 3.

procstep.procdesc: An existing shape file of the parcel polygons was fit to the orthophotography with input form the assessor on areas that did not match the imagery well and with mismatches. (2016) The parcels were updated both spatially and attribute wise based on notes from the assessor, marked up assessor maps and survey plans provided by the assessor.

attracc.attraccr:
Total number of parcels = 2678 Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 99.8 pct Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 97.0 pct
Total number of records in assessor table = 2700 Total records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 2110 Of these, total records with valid LOC_ID that join to tax parcels: 2107 Match rate for parcels where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 99.9 pct High value match rate passes QA.
Total records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL < $1000: 590 Of these, total records with valid LOC_ID join to tax parcels: 566 Match rate for parcels where BLDG_VAL and OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 95.9 pct **** Low value match rate is below spec. Does not pass QA.
Checking match rate of parcels to assessor list... --------------------------------------------- Required match rate for 2678 parcels: 99.0 pct Total number of parcels with "TAX" or "FEE" POLY_TYPE and NO_MATCH = "N": 2665 Of these, 2641 join to assessor list. Match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.1 pct Parcel to assessor match rate is ok. Passes QA.

overview.dsoverv: M179TaxPar represents a version of digital municipal parcels for the community of Mendon that is considered ‘level 3’ compliant per the specifications outlined in the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files. Its features can be linked in a GIS or database environment to a set of standardized assessing attributes in the table M179Assess by using the unique identifying values in the LOC_ID field. This data is also intended to be used in conjunction with associated (and optional) features in the ancillary data layers M###OthLeg and M###Misc. As one of the data sets identified by Massachusetts’ Strategic Plan for Spatial Data Infrastructure (http://www.mass.gov/mgis/stratplan.html), this data enters the public domain as a valuable resource for mapping, planning, and analysis at all levels of government as well as the private sector.
overview.eaover:
For a full description of the features and attributes contained in this data, please refer to the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.0.
http://www.mass.gov/mgis/standards.htm#Parstandard

distinfo.custom: Upon compliance with level 3 of the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files, this data will be made available for download on the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis/parcels.htm

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer. The spatial data and CAMA data was updated in 2016 by CMRPC as part of a MassGIS enhancement project. The spatial data and CAMA data is updated on an annual basis by the Central Massachusetts Regional Planning Commission (CMRPC). The data was last updated in 2025.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: CMRPC and Town of Mendon. Initial data conversion by James W. Sewall Company

Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.

(2016) The parcels were updated both spatially and attribute wise based on notes from the assessor, marked up assessor maps and survey plans provided by the assessor.
